intro: Mesembryanthemum atratum, commonly known as the darkleaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are usually dark green to almost black, giving it a striking appearance. Mesembryanthemum atratum is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
